alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale; Geneva (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 25 at 4:48AM CST until January 25 at 5:15AM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM CST FOR DALE...EASTERN COFFEE AND WESTERN GENEVA COUNTIES... At 448 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Doster to 7 miles south of Samson, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Daleville, Geneva, Enterprise, Fort Rucker, Ozark, Level Plains, Samson, Newton, New Brockton, Ariton, Clayhatchee, Coffee Springs, Mixons Crossroads, Kellys Crossroads, Hunt Field, Waterford, Hooper Stage Field, Gerald, Central City and Logan Field Municipal A/P. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CST for southeastern Alabama...and the Panhandle of Florida. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Tallahassee.
